Key Match Events: England won by 4 wickets with 2 balls remaining.
Mark Wood took 3 wickets for 26 runs.
Chris Woakes hit the winning runs with a cut for four.
Sri Lanka scored 141/8 in their innings.
England chased down the target with 144/6 in 19.4 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Dasun Shanaka chose to bat first due to a used surface and the fact that teams batting first had won the last five matches at the venue.
Jos Buttler also wanted to bat first for the same reason.
Only one change in the teams: Chamika Karunaratne came in for Pramod Madushan for Sri Lanka.
Post-Match Reflections: England are through to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup, knocking Australia out in the process.

For Australia, now officially done as defending champions, they will wonder what might have been having relinquished the opportunity to surpass England’s net run rate with their own modest win over Afghanistan on Friday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch slowed down during the match, affecting the batting conditions.
Sri Lanka managed just six boundaries after the seventh over.
Sam Curran continued his impressive performance as a death bowler.
Dawid Malan pulled his groin in the field and was unable to bat at his usual spot.
